ai-tha-ap7:1.1_0: “While staying in the middle of a lake,
ai-tha-ap7:1.2_0: a master of the three Vedas:
ai-tha-ap7:1.3_0: At the moment of men when they have come.
ai-tha-ap7:1.4_0: I came to the supreme city.
ai-tha-ap7:2.3_0: he presented my work to me.
ai-tha-ap7:3.3_0: raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-tha-ap7:5.3_0: the one who knows the teachings,
ai-tha-ap7:5.4_0: The account of the purification of ethics
ai-tha-ap7:5.5_0: all that they had asked for.
ai-tha-ap7:7.3_0: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
ai-tha-ap7:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta.
ai-tha-ap7:9.1_0: when the fifth Elder Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta was finished in the fifth
